segments.text: Oh my gosh, the sink is overflowing—I can't believe my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's pouring over the edge in a steady stream onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, drying a plate, and hasn't turned off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's in the puddle; how hasn't she felt it yet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window above shows a lovely garden, all calm and green.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But look at the kids—the boy's climbing a stool to the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's tilting back; this is shocking, he could topple any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's grabbing cookies with one hand, plate in the other.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching up to him, expecting her treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're so focused, not noticing the water hazard below.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are open wide, cookies visible inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I never expected such sneaky fun mixed with real danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen feels alive with this unexpected chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
